intro: Psychotria coelocalyx, commonly known as the Jamaican morning glory, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the Caribbean, particularly Jamaica. It is a flowering plant characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and psychoactive properties, it is sometimes cultivated for both aesthetic and traditional uses.
